profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-01 15:32:13 -0700.

did.unittitle: Nat Farber television show music arrangements

physdesc.extent: (4 flat boxes and 5 oversize flat boxes)

did.abstract: The collection consists of manuscript scores for arrangements by Nat Farber and others for The Carol Burnett Show, The Danny Kaye Show, The Dinah Shore Chevy Show, and other productions. Also included are scripts and rehearsal schedules for The Carol Burnett Show.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nat Farber Television Show Music Arrangements (Collection PASC-M 33). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Nat Farber (born 20 January 1918) was an American composer, pianist and arranger, who worked for several television programs and for the film studios of RKO, Columbia, and Disney. Born in Chicago, IL, Farber attended the Chicago Musical College and later the Los Angeles Conservatory of Music. He studied with Ernst Toch and Mario Castelnuovo- Tedesco. Notable work includes the Dina Shore Show (1959-1963), the Danny Kaye Show (1963- 1967), and the Carol Burnett Show (1967- 1975). He also worked in the music department for the Roy Rogers Show (1951), The Andy Williams Show (1959), and the Judy Garland Show (1962), and as a dance accompanyist for the film Mary Poppins (1964). Farber died on September 14, 1975, in Los Angeles, CA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of manuscripts and reproductions of arrangements for The Carol Burnett Show, The Danny Kaye Show, The Dinah Shore Chevy Show, and other productions. Included are manuscript sketches and final copies of vocal, piano, and orchestral scores for transitions, background music, and song and dance numbers. The works of various arrangers are represented. Also included are scripts and air sequence sheets for The Carol Burnett Show.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection has been organized into the following series:
Series 1: Carol Burnett Show
Subseries 1.1: Arrangements
Subseries 1.2: Air sequences and scripts
Series 2: Danny Kaye Show
Series 3: Dinah Shore Show
Series 4: Other shows
Series 5: Unidentified arrangements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of sheet music for the arrangements used in The Carol Burnett Show. Also included are scripts and air sequences for various episodes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sheet music consists largely of manuscripts and reproductions of vocal scores for various song and dance numbers. Contents are largely completed scores, though there are also some sketches and scores with annotations. Includes treatments by Mitzie and Ken Welch, R. Bundock, Max Ehrmann, Coleman Fields, Peter Matz, E.A. Swan, and Fred Werner. Original titles have been maintained and are arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Ain't Got Nothin But the Blues Medley
Harnick and Bock Mini- Musical Finale
I Don't Want to Be Nelson
It's Time to Say So Long
Oh, To Be a Movie Star
There Was a Little Girl Medley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cleopatra finale, Harnick and Bock mini-musical finale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Script likely belongs to episode #902, featuring Sammy Davis Jr. Aired 20 September 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of sheet music for the arrangements used in The Danny Kaye Show, and largely contains manuscript sketches for vocal, piano, and orchestral scores, though there are also a few reproductions. Includes arrangements by Billy Barnes and Earl Brown. Original titles have been maintained and arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: The Ballad of Red Ridin' Hood
Christmas Fantasy Dance - Old Friends Medley
Hand Me Down My Walkin Cane
You Make Me Feel So Young

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of sheet music for the arrangements used in The Dinah Shore Chevy Show, and includes manuscripts and reproductions of vocal and piano scores. Includes arrangements by Earl Brown and Harry Zimmerman. Original titles have been maintained and arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: In the Still of the Night

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains sheet music for the arrangements used in various other shows. It consists largely of reproductions of completed vocal scores, though a few manuscript sketches are also included.
Includes arrangements by Peter Jennaro and Vic Shoen.

did.unittitle: Glen Campbell Goodtime Hour: "I'll Never Fall in Love Again"
Judy Garland Show: "West Side Story Medley (Show #17)"
Mary Tyler Moore Show: "Ten Cents a Dance"
Mary Tyler Moore Show: "30s Movie Production Number"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of titled but largely undated sheet music works. Affiliation has not been conclusively established for these scores, but they likely belong, at least in part, to the television shows named in previous series. Includes manuscripts and reproductions of vocal scores, instrumental parts, and a few full scores. There is an equal distribution of finished scores and sketches. Original titles have been maintained and grouped alphabetically by letter.
Includes arrangements by Jerry Bock, Luiz Bonfa, Don Ellis, Ray Evans, Hal Hopper, Jay Livingston, Johnny Mann, Richard Priborsky, Richard Sherman, Robert Sherman, and Paul Weston.
